motivation.why_this_matters: Linear algebra is the mathematical foundation of machine learning. Every neural network forward pass, every optimization step, every data transformation uses these concepts. Mastering this week gives you the tools to understand how ML really works under the hood.
motivation.real_world_impact: The PageRank algorithm that made Google billions is just finding eigenvectors. Netflix's recommendation engine uses matrix factorization. Computer graphics, image processing, and data compression all rely on linear algebra. You're learning the math that powers the digital world.
motivation.career_relevance: Understanding linear algebra separates ML practitioners who can only use libraries from those who can innovate, debug, and optimize. It's the difference between following recipes and being a chef.
